text: The 2002 Pro Bowl was the NFL's all-star game for the 2001 season. The game was played on February 9, 2002, at Aloha Stadium in Honolulu, Hawaii. The final score was AFC 38, NFC 30. Rich Gannon of the Oakland Raiders was the game's MVP. ==AFC roster== ===Offense=== Position Starter(s) Reserve(s) Alternate(s) Quarterback Rich Gannon, Oakland Tom Brady, New England Kordell Stewart, Pittsburgh Running back Curtis Martin, N.Y. Jets Jerome Bettis, Pittsburgh Priest Holmes, Kansas City Corey Dillon, Cincinnati Fullback Larry Centers, Buffalo Wide receiver Marvin Harrison, Indianapolis Rod Smith, Denver Tim Brown, Oakland Jimmy Smith, Jacksonville Troy Brown, New England Hines Ward, Pittsburgh Tight end Tony Gonzalez, Kansas City Shannon Sharpe, Baltimore Ken Dilger, Indianapolis Dwayne Carswell, Denver Offensive tackle Lincoln Kennedy, Oakland Jonathan Ogden, Baltimore Walter Jones, Seattle Offensive guard Alan Faneca, Pittsburgh Will Shields, Kansas City Ruben Brown, Buffalo Center Kevin Mawae, N.Y. Jets Bruce Matthews, Tennessee ===Defense=== Position Starter(s) Reserve(s) Alternate(s) Defensive end John Abraham, N.Y. Jets Marcellus Wiley, San Diego Jevon Kearse, Tennessee Defensive tackle Trevor Pryce, Denver John Randle, Seattle Sam Adams, Baltimore Gary Walker, Jacksonville Outside linebacker Jason Gildon, Pittsburgh Jamir Miller, Cleveland Junior Seau, San Diego Inside linebacker Ray Lewis, Baltimore Zach Thomas, Miami Al Wilson, Denver Kendrell Bell, Pittsburgh Cornerback Sam Madison, Miami Charles Woodson, Oakland Deltha O'Neal, Denver Ryan McNeil, San Diego Ty Law, New England Free safety Rod Woodson, Baltimore Strong safety Rodney Harrison, San Diego Lawyer Milloy, New England ===Special teams=== Position Starter(s) Reserve(s) Alternate(s) Punter Shane Lechler, Oakland Placekicker Jason Elam, Denver Kick returner Jermaine Lewis, Baltimore Special teamer Ian Gold, Denver ==NFC roster== ===Offense=== Position Starter(s) Reserve(s) Alternate(s) Quarterback Brett Favre, Green Bay Kurt Warner, St. Louis Jeff Garcia, San Francisco Donovan McNabb, Philadelphia Running back Marshall Faulk, St. Louis Ahman Green, Green Bay Garrison Hearst, San Francisco Fullback Mike Alstott, Tampa Bay Wide receiver David Boston, Arizona Terrell Owens, San Francisco Isaac Bruce, St. Louis Keyshawn Johnson, Tampa Bay Joe Horn, New Orleans Torry Holt, St. Louis Tight end Bubba Franks, Green Bay Wesley Walls, Carolina Byron Chamberlain, Minnesota Offensive tackle Orlando Pace, St. Louis Chris Samuels, Washington James Williams, Chicago Tra Thomas, Philadelphia Offensive guard Larry Allen, Dallas Ron Stone, N.Y. Giants Ray Brown, San Francisco Adam Timmerman, St. Louis Center Olin Kreutz, Chicago Matt Birk, Minnesota Jeremy Newberry, San Francisco ===Defense=== Position Starter(s) Reserve(s) Alternate(s) Defensive end Hugh Douglas, Philadelphia Michael Strahan, N.Y. Giants Robert Porcher, Detroit Defensive tackle La'Roi Glover, New Orleans Warren Sapp, Tampa Bay Bryant Young, San Francisco Ted Washington, Chicago Outside linebacker LaVar Arrington, Washington Derrick Brooks, Tampa Bay Jessie Armstead, N.Y. Giants Dexter Coakley, Dallas Inside linebacker Brian Urlacher, Chicago Jeremiah Trotter, Philadelphia Keith Brooking, Atlanta Cornerback Ronde Barber, Tampa Bay Aeneas Williams, St. Louis Troy Vincent, Philadelphia Champ Bailey, Washington Free safety Brian Dawkins, Philadelphia Strong safety Sammy Knight, New Orleans John Lynch, Tampa Bay ===Special teams=== Position Starter(s) Reserve(s) Alternate(s) Punter Todd Sauerbrun, Carolina Placekicker David Akers, Philadelphia Kick returner Steve Smith, Carolina Special teamer Larry Whigham, Chicago Long snapper Chad Lewis, Philadelphia ==Number of players per team== AFC Team Players NFC Team Players Denver Broncos 7 Philadelphia Eagles 8 Baltimore Ravens 6 St. Louis Rams 7 Pittsburgh Steelers 6 San Francisco 49ers 6 Oakland Raiders 5 Tampa Bay Buccaneers 6 New England Patriots 4 Chicago Bears 5 San Diego Chargers 4 Carolina Panthers 3 Kansas City Chiefs 3 Green Bay Packers 3 New York Jets 3 New Orleans Saints 3 Tennessee Titans 3 New York Giants 3 Buffalo Bills 2 Washington Redskins 3 Indianapolis Colts 2 Dallas Cowboys 2 Miami Dolphins 2 Minnesota Vikings 2 Seattle Seahawks 2 Arizona Cardinals 1 Cincinnati Bengals 1 Atlanta Falcons 1 Cleveland Browns 1 Detroit Lions 1 Jacksonville Jaguars 1 ==References== ==Other websites== *Official Pro Bowl website at NFL.com Pro Bowl Category:2002 in sports Category:Honolulu
